intro: Hornea mauritiana, commonly known as the Mauritius hornea, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many tropical shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Hornea mauritiana is adapted to the humid, subtropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in forested areas.
